name: goodybag-cli
description: The goodybag kickass command line interface.

help.help: Prints the basic usage information on each [COMMAND] given (1 or more). Otherwise, prints the full table of available commands.

version.help: Prints out the current version of goodybag-cli.

start.help: Starts the server from scratch if no flags are given. This means starting Postgres, redis, mongod, grunt, and finally the goodybag-cater server, in that order. If flags are given, then only the processes specified will start. If a process is already started, it will be ignored.

stop.help: Stops the server, closing all processes with it (e.g., Postgres, redis, mongod, grunt). If flags are given, then only the processes specified will be stopped. If a process is already stopped, it will be ignored.

restart.help: If no flags are given, the server will experience a full reboot. If flags are given, then only the processes specified will be restarted.
